consumeR: Transparent and Reproducible Consumer Research Analysis

Source: R/consumeR-package.R, R/imports.R
consumeR-package.Rd

The consumeR package provides transparent, well-documented functions for consumer research analysis that facilitate reproducibility during peer review. All functions are designed with clarity and readability in mind, making code easy to understand for reviewers with varying levels of programming experience.

Provides transparent, well-documented functions for consumer research analysis that facilitate reproducibility during peer review. All functions are designed with clarity and readability in mind using tidyverse principles, making code easy to understand for reviewers with varying levels of programming experience. Includes descriptive statistics, group comparisons, reliability analysis (Cronbach's alpha, composite reliability, AVE), and factor analysis (EFA/CFA) with beautiful ggplot2 visualizations. Functions include clear documentation, sensible defaults, and extensive examples.

Main Functions

calculate_summary_stats

Calculate descriptive statistics with clear, step-by-step documentation

test_group_differences

Compare two groups with transparent statistical testing

create_analysis_report

Generate comprehensive, human-readable analysis reports

Design Philosophy

The package is designed for maximum transparency in research:

  • Every function includes extensive inline comments explaining each step

  • Input validation with clear error messages

  • Automatic handling and reporting of missing values

  • Plain English interpretations of statistical results

  • Complete documentation with multiple examples
